dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car is being hoisted up by a municipal tow truck while having a terrible screaming arguement with a parking enfo DANA BARRETT comes home pushing a baby buggy, struggling bags of groceries, and trying to dig her keys out of her building superintendent FRANK, sees her struggling but pr notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Frank, do you think you could give me a hand with these bags?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a doorman, Miss Barrett.  I'm a building superintendent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're also a human being, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly going to help) Okay, okay.  It's not my job, but what the hell.  I'll do you a favor.  He takes the grocery bags from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (setting the wheel brakes on the buggy) Thank you, Frank.  I'll get the hang of this eventually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues digging in her purse while Frank leans over makes funny faces at the baby, OSCAR, a very cute nine-mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the baby) Hiya, Oscar.  What do you say, slugger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dana) That's a good-looking kid you got there, Ms. Barrett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finding her keys) Thank you, Frank.  Oh, are you ever going to fix the radiator in my bedroom?  I asked you last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I do it?

dialogues.speaker: BABY BUGGY
dialogues.text: It starts to vibrate as if shaken by an unseen hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He GURGLES with delight at the movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither of them notice the movement of the carriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you didn't, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what you said last week.

dialogues.speaker: BUGGY WHEELS
dialogues.text: The brakes unlock themselves.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: She reaches for the handlebar of the buggy, but the buggy just out of her reach and stops.  Surprised by the moveme for the handlebar again, but this time the buggy rolls aw further.  Alarmed now, Dana hurries after it, but the bug rolling down the street at ever increasing speed.

dialogues.speaker: SIDEWALK
dialogues.text: Dana chases the buggy down the street, shouting to passin for help, but every time someone reaches out to stop it, swerves and continues unchecked.

dialogues.speaker: INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: Cars, trucks, and buses speed by in both directions as th toward the corner.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: She puts her head down and sprints after the buggy like a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A city bus is on a collision course with the speeding bab

dialogues.speaker: BUGGY
dialogues.text: It careens toward the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its eyes are wide open with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bus and buggy are closing fast as the buggy bounces over into the crosswalk.

dialogues.speaker: BUS
dialogues.text: The bus driver reacts in helpless horror as he sees the b intersection at high speed.

dialogues.speaker: BUGGY
dialogues.text: It comes to a dead stop right in the middle of the street continues missing the buggy by inches.

dialogues.speaker: INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: Cars and trucks swerve and hit their brakes as Dana runs intersection and snatches up the baby.  She hugs it close relieved, then looks at the buggy with the dawning awaren supernatural has re-entered her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEME MUSIC kicks in strongly as we see the familiar "No and PULL BACK to reveal that it's painted on the side of Ghostbusters' emergency vehicle, which is speeding up Bro Upper West Side.  RAY STANTZ is driving and WINSTON ZEDDE shotgun.

dialogues.text: The Ectomobile pulls up in front of a carefully-restored Stantz and Winston, wearing their official Ghostbuster un out of the old ambulance, shoulder their proton packs and house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN greets them and leads them through the expensivel house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all business) How many of them are there, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen.  They're in the back.  I hope you can handle them.  It's been like a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds her hand out indicating about four feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resolute) We'll do our best, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're right out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads them to a set of French doors that open into an Stantz and Winston pause to make final adjustments to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes through the French doors and they step into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are immediately attacked by fourteen or fifteen scre between the ages of seven and ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Ghostbusters!!  Boooo!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tables are set with party favors, ice cream and birthday room is strewn with discarded toys and games.  A couple o sink onto lawn chairs as Stantz and Winston take over the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying his best) How you doin', kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nasty) I though we were having He-Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He-Man couldn't make it today.  That's why we're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad says you're full of crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopped cold) Well, a lot of people have trouble believing in the paranormal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he just says you're full of crap and that's why you went out of business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kicks Stantz in the leg.  Stantz grabs him by the shir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low and menacing) I'm watching you. (to Winston) Song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston switches on a tiny TAPE RECORDER which starts PLA Ghostbusters THEME SONG. Stantz and WInston start singing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'There's something wrong in the neighborhood. Who you gonna call?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all together) He-Man!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz and Winston wearily load their equipment into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, Ray.  I've had it.  No more parties. I'm tired of taking abuse from over-privileged nine-year-olds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Winston.  We can't quit now.  The holidays are coming up.  It's our best season.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get in the car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz tries to start the car, but the engine won't turn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up, Ray.  You're living in the past. Ghostbusters doesn't exist anymore.  In a year these kids won't even remember who we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to start the car again) Ungrateful little Yuppie larvae.  After all we did for this city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what did we do, Ray?  The last real job we had we bubbled up a hundred foot marshmallow man and blew the top three floors off an uptown highrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what a ride.  You can't make a hamburger without chopping up a cow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns the key again, the ENGING TURNS OVER, then start CLUNKING disastrously, chewing up vital parts and droppin of metal onto the pavement.  Finally, with a BLAST of bla exhaust from the tailpipe, Ecto-1 shudders and dies.  Fru bangs his head lightly on the steering wheel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bank of monitors in the lobby show the program now runn Channel 10 in New York. We PUSH IN ON one of the monitors card and logo come up accompanied by some EERIE SYNTHESIZ we return to the show in progress: "World of the Psychic Venkman."  There is a video dissolve to a standard talk s sitting there is our host PETER VENKMAN, the renowned and infamous ex-Ghostbuster.

dialogues.speaker: VENKMAN
dialogues.text: He turns TO CAMERA and talks to his viewers in a suavely understated and intimate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, welcome back to the 'World of the Psychic,' I'm Peter Venkman and I'm chatting with my guest, author, lecturer and of course, psychic, Milton Anglund. (to his guest) Milt, your new book is called The End of the World.  Isn't that kind of like writing about gum disease.  Yes, it could happen, but do you think anybody wants to read a book about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think it's important for people to know that the world is in danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so can you tell us when it's going to happen or do we have to buy the book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I predict that the world will end at the stroke of midnight on New Year's Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This year?  That's cutting it a little close, isn't it?  I mean, just from a sales point of view, the book just came out, right?  So you're not even looking at the paperback release for maybe a year.  And it's going to be at least another year after that if the thing has movie-of-the-week or mini-series potential. You would have been better off predicting 1992 or even '94 just to be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) This is not just some money-making scheme!  I didn't just make up the date.  I have a strong psychic belief that the world will end on New Year's Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (placating) Well, for your sake, I hope you're right.  But I think my other guest may disagree with you. Elaine, you had another date in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA REVEALS ELAINE, an attractive, aggressive New housewife, sitting on the other side of Venkman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to my sources, the world will end on February 14, in the year 2016.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine's Day.  That's got to be a bummer. Where did you get that date, Elaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I received this information from an alien.  I was at the Paramus Holiday Inn, I was having a drink in the bar when he approached me and started talking.  Then he must have used some sort of ray or a mind control device because he made me follow him to his room and that's where he told me about the end of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your alien had a room in the Holiday Inn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may have been a room on the spacecraft made up to look like a room in the Holiday Inn.  I can't be sure, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (humoring her) No, you can't, and I think that's the whole problem with aliens; you just can't trust them. You may get some nice ones occasionally like Starman or E.T., but most of them turn out to be some kind of lizard.  Anyway, we're just about out of time. (does his wrap-up right TO the CAMERA) Next week on 'World of the Psychic,' hairless pets. (holds up a hairless cat) Until then, this is Peter Venkman saying ... (puts a finger to his temple and sends out a though to his viewers) ... Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman comes out of the studio squabbling with his produ well-meaning young incompetent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you find these people?  I thought we were having the telekinetic guy who bends the spoons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of the better psychics won't come on the show.  They think you're too skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skeptical!  Norman, I'm a pushover.  I think professional wrestling is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a small commotion down the hall as two plainclot out of the next studio followed by a group of mayoral ass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Norman) What's all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just interviewed the mayor on 'Cityline.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor!  He's a friend of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman starts down the hall as the MAYOR and his princip HARDEMEYER, come walking out of the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to the Mayor) Lenny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor sees Venkman, blanches and hurries off, pretend him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts to follow him) Lenny!  It's Pete Venkman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plainclothesmen cut Venkman off and Hardemeyer puts a against Venkman's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snide) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dangerous) Yeah, you can get your hand off my chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardemeyer smiles and drops his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jack Hardemeyer.  I'm the mayor's assistant. What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an old friend of the mayor's.  I just want to say hello to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scornful) I know who you are, Doctor Venkman.  Busting any ghosts lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's what I want to talk to the mayor about.  We did a little job for the city a while back and we ended up getting sued, screwed and tattooed by deskworms like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bristling) Look, you stay away from the mayor.  Next fall, barring a disaster, he's going to be elected governor of this state and the last thing we need is for him to be associated with two-bit frauds and publicity hounds like you and your friends.  You read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardemeyer walks off with the two cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I get it.  But I want you to tell Lenny that, because of you, I'm not voting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The broad front steps of the museum are crowded with tour visitors.  Dana arrives carrying a portfolio and artist's enters the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are FULL-FRAME ON a larger-than-life, full-figure port THE CARPATHIAN, a demented and sadistic 16th century desp incredibly powerful evil presence.  Then we PULL BACK to studio, which is a large open space on the top floor of t by large skylights in the ceiling.  Working on the Vigo p JANOSZ POHA, a youngish art historian and painter, the he department, quirky, intense and somewhat creepy.  Janosz longingly across the room at Dana.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: She is carefully cleaning a 19th Century landscape painti preoccupied by the extraordinary near-accident with the b watches her for a moment, then comes up behind her and lo shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with an East European accent) Still working on the Turner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana jumps, startled by the intrusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, I got in a little late this morning, Janosz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you are really doing very good work here.  I think soon you may be ready to assist me in some of the more important restorations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Janosz.  I've learned a lot here, but now that my baby's a little older, I was hoping to rejoin the orchestra.

dialogues.speaker: VIGO PAINTING
dialogues.text: At the mention of Dana's baby, the figure of Vigo miracul head and looks at Dana.

dialogues.speaker: JANOSZ AND DANA
dialogues.text: Neither of them notice the movement in the painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) We'll be very sorry to lose you.  Perhaps I could take you to lunch today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm not eating lunch today.  I have an appointment. (looks at her watch) In fact, I'd better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts gathering up her things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day I ask you, and every day you've got something else to do.  Do I have bad breath or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to brush him off) I'm sorry.  Perhaps some other time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll take a raincheck on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janosz smiles at her as she exits, then goes back to his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) I think she likes me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He switches on an English language TAPE and starts practi phrases as he resumes working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana Barrett crosses the quad and enters a modern buildin identifies it as "The Institute for Advanced Theoretical

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana is explaining the buggy incident to EGON SPENGLER, t intellectual techno-wizard and former Ghostbuster, as he experiment assisted by a research team of graduate studen are Japanese, Chinese, or Korean.  The device he is testi box about the size of a Sony Watchman with both digital a displays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then the buggy just suddenly stopped dead in the middle of the street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did anyone else see this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of people.  Believe me, I didn't imagine this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying you did.  In science we always look for the simplest explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ASSISTANT interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ready, Dr. Spengler

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Assistant) We'll start with the negative calibration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the device and prepares to test it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curious) What are you working on, Egon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to determine whether human emotional states have a measurable effect on the psychomagnetheric energy field.  It's a theory Ray and I were working on when we had to dissolve Ghostbusters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An assistant draws a curtain revealing a large picture wi a two-way mirror, that looks into a small waiting room. waiting room they can see but not hear a youngish couple arguement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dana) They think they're here for marriage counseling.  We've kept them waiting for two hours and we've been gradually increasing the temperature in the room. (checking a heat sensor) It's up to 95 degrees at the moment.  Now my assistant is going to enter and ask them if they'd mind waiting another half-hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Spengler, Dana, and the research team watch, the assis waiting room and tells the couple about the new delay.  T with anger both at him and each other while Spengler moni through the glass.  After recording his readings, he retu Assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do the happiness index next. (to Dana) I'd like to bring Ray in on your case, if it's all right with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, whatever you think -- but not Venkman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (affectedly casual) Do you ever see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Occasionally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman?  I think he was borderline for a while there.  Then he crossed the border.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he ever mention me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not that I can recall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move to another two-way mirror through which they ca little girl playing with a wonderful array of toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly disappointed) Well, we didn't part on very good terms and we sort of lost track of each other when I got married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Assistant interrupts again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ready for the affection test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the assistant) Good.  Send in the puppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I thought of calling him after my marriage ended, but --.  Anyway, I appreciate you're doing this, Egon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch as another assistant enters the playroom with Cocker Spaniel puppy and gives it to the little girl.  Sp her as she jumps for joy and hugs the little dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him a card) This is my address and telephone number. Will you call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egon, I'd rather you didn't mention any of this to Peter if you don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes his hand and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his assistant) Now let's see how she reacts when we take away the puppy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small basement shop located on a quaint commercial Greenwich Village.  The window is crowded with occult art books full of arcane metaphysical lore.  The TELEPHONE RI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (v.o., answering the phone) Ray's Occult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shelves are jammed floor to ceiling with books on the Ray sits on a barstool behind the counter wearing an old sweater over a T-shirt.  He has on a pair of reading glas on a battered, reeking pipe.  As he talks on the phone he of herb tea for Spengler who is thumbing through an arcan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Yeah ... mmhmm ... What do you need? ... What have I got?  I've got alchemy, astrology, apparitions, Bundu Magic Men, demon intercession, U.F.O. abductions, psychic surgery, stigmata, modern miracles, pixie sightings, golden geese, geists, ghosts, I've got it all -- what are you looking for? ... Don't have any.  Try the stockyards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some crank.  Looking for goat hooves.  Come up with anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the book) This one's interesting.  Berlin, 1939, a flower cart took off by itself and rolled approximately half a kilometer over level ground.  Three hundred eyewitnesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might want to check those Duke University mean averaging studies on controlled psychokinesis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going to the stacks) Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bones hanging over the door rattle as Venkman enters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello, perhaps you could help me.  I'm looking for an aerosol love potion I could spray on a certain Penthouse Pet that would make her unconditionally submit to an unusual personal request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hiya, Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, no goat hooves, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strung) I knew that voice sounded familiar.  What's up?  How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere -- fast.  Why don't you lock up and buy me a sub?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly evasive) Uh, I can't.  I'm kind of working on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spengler steps out of the stacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Venkman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How've you been?  How's teaching?  I bet those science chicks really dig that big cranium of yours, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they're more interested in my epididymis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even want to know where that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman steps behind the counter and takes a beer from Ra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, your book came in, Venkman.  Magical Paths to Fortune and Power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Venkman the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. (reading the contents) So what are you guys working on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just checking something for an old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at a loss) Who?  Just -- someone we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Ray --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Stantz by both ears and pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?  Who?  Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaah!  Nobody!  I can't tell you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving in) Dana!  Dana Barrett!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman lets go of his ears and smiles.  Spengler looks a shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment is old and creatively furnished with a comf modern and traditional pieces.  Maria, a young Hispanic w day care for Dana, is feeding the baby in the kitchen whe RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana enters from the bedroom and crosses to the front doo it and admits Ray and Egon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugging Ray) Hi, Ray.  It's good to see you.  Thanks for coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.  Always glad to help -- and hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spengler) Hi, Egon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes his hand and is about to close the door when V in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Dana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana is caught completely off guard by Venkman's surprise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd come crawling back to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She regards him coolly, as always amused and amazed at hi presumptuousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dana) You know, Dana, I'm very very hurt that you didn't call me first.  I'm still into all this stuff, you know.  Haven't you ever seen my show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have.  That's why I didn't call you first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that you're still very bitter about us, but in the interest of science, I'm going to give it my best shot.  Let's go to work, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz and Spengler begin a comprehensive parapsychologic the baby and the immediate physical environment.

dialogues.speaker: VENKMAN AND DANA
dialogues.text: Venkman starts nosing around the apartment.  Dana follows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened to Mr. Right?  I hear he ditched you and the kid and moved to Europe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't "ditch" me.  We had some problems, he got a good offer from an orchestra in England and he took it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ditched you.  You should've married me, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never asked me, and every time I brought it up you'd get drowsy and fall asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men are very sensitive, you know.  We need to feel loved and desired, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you started introducing me as "the old ball and chain," that's when I left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may have a few personal problems but one thing I am is a total professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves her and crosses to Spengler.

dialogues.speaker: SPENGLER
dialogues.text: He's taking a complete set of body and head measurements with a tape measure and calipers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do, Egon?  Knit him a snowsuit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spengler ignores the remark and hands Venkman a specimen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to have a stool specimen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you would.  Is that for personal or professional reasons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up the baby) Okay, kid.  Up you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts clowning with the baby, holding him over his he his nose into the baby's belly, pretending that the baby him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!  Please somebody help me!  Get him off! Quickly!  He's gone completely berserk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana is amused and somewhat disarmed by Venkman's rapport

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no doubt about it.  He's got his father's looks.  The kid is ugly -- extremely ugly.  And smelly. (resumes playing with the baby) You stink!  It's just horrible.  You are the stinkiest baby I ever smelled. (to Dana) What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oscar!  You poor kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing patience) Peter, this is serious.  I need to know if you think there's anything unusual about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unusual? (holds up the baby and scrutinizes him) I don't know.  I haven't had a lot of experience with babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the baby, pulling his feet up, trying to get off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the specimen jar) I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll supervise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman enters and finds Stantz monitoring the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stantz) Well, Holmes, what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an interesting one, Pete.  If anything was going on it's totally subdued now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spengler enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spengler) What now, Brainiac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should see if we can find anything abnormal on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finding something abnormal on the street shouldn't be too hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana walks down the street with Venkman, retracing the pa runaway buggy.  Spengler and Stantz follow, monitoring PK the pavement and the buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dana, nostalgic) Brings back a lot of sweet memories, doesn't it? (pointing out familiar neighborhood sights) There's our old cash machine.  And the dry cleaners we used to go to.  And the old video store. (he wipes away an imaginary tear) We really had some good times, didn't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We definitely had a moment or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana stops at the intersection and points to the middle o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where the buggy stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman walks right out into the middle of the street, co oblivious to the CARS HONKING and whizzing past him and s like a traffic cop, bringing traffic to a standstill.  Th for Dana, Stantz and Spengler to join him in the middle o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the PKE meter) Is this the spot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little to the left.  Right there!  That's where it stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz reads the PKE meter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Not a trace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we try the Giga-meter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Egon and I have been working on a gauge to measure psychomagnetheric energy in GEVs - giga electron volts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a thousand million electron volts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spengler switches on the Giga-meter, the device he was te lab, and passes it over the spot on the street where the The indicator goes right into the red zone and the DEVICE WILDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we hit the honeypot, boys.  There's something brewing under the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried, to Venkman) Peter, do you think maybe I have some genetic problem or something that makes me vulnerable to these supernatural things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like the time you got possessed and turned into a monster terror dog?  No, not a chance.  Total coincidence. (to Stantz and Spengler) Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz and Spengler look at him skeptically, not convince coincidence theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The museum has just closed for the day and the last of th employees are leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janosz is working late on the painting of Vigo.

dialogues.speaker: VIGO PAINTING
dialogues.text: Unnoticed by Janosz, the eyes of Vigo start to glow.

dialogues.speaker: JANOSZ
dialogues.text: He touches his brush to the canvas and a powerful current crackling energy surges through the brush and courses thr driving him to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: PAINTING
dialogues.text: The figure of Vigo comes to life, turns toward Janosz and dramatically at him.  Then he speaks to Janosz in a comma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, Vigo, the scourge of Carpathia, the sorrow of Moldavia, command you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in agony) Command me, lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a mountain of skulls in a castle of pain, I sat on a throne of blood.  What was will be, what is will be no more.  Now is the season of evil.  Find me a child that I might live again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bolts of red-hot energy shoot from the eyes of Vigo into He screams and falls to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman and Stantz come out with small boxes containing c sandwiches and Danish and start walking up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love this.  We're onto something really big.  I can smell it, Ray.  We're going to make some headlines with this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey, stresshound!  Are you nuts? If anybody found out about this we'd be in serious trouble.  The judge couldn't have been clearer - no ghostbusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax.  We're going to keep this whole thing nice and quiet, low key, no profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spengler, wearing a hardhat, is JACKHAMMERING a hole in t street.  Safety cones and reflectors have been set up and lit by strong work lights.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: It turns onto East 77th Street, cruises slowly up to the worksite and stops.  The noise of the JACKHAMMER is so lo doesn't notice the police car and the two COPS inside loo Finally, he looks up, sees the police car and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reeking with guilt) Fine!  It's cutting fine now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curious) Why are you cutting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking for one of the others) Why are we cutting?  Uh - boss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman and Stantz arrive just in time wearing Con Ed har good imitation of a Consolidated Edison repairman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (belligerent) What the hell's it look like we're doing? We're bustin out asses over here 'cause some douchebag downtown ain't got nothin' better to do than make idiots like us work late on a Friday night, right? (looks to Spengler for agreement)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a "right on" fist) Yo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops seem satisfied by the explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, boys, take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive off.  Spengler breathes a great sigh of relief rubbing his sore shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were supposed to help me with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need the exercise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz resumes JACKHAMMERING, while Venkman and Spengler rubble from the hole.  Suddenly he hits metal.  They clea generations of paving material revealing an ornate iron m The manhole cover bears a strange logo and the letters NY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examing it) NYPRR.  What the hell -- ?  Help me lift this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They prey off the iron cover with crowbars, uncovering a very deep abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shining a flashlight into the hole) Wow!  It's an old airshaft.  It just goes forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spengler leans in with the giga-meter which is reading ev

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very intense.  We need a deeper reading. Somebody has to go down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman and Spengler both look at Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They snap Stantz into a harness and lower him into the ho cable attached to a winch.  Ray calls out orders to them deeper and deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his voice echoing in the airshaft) Keep going -- more -- more --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz rappels off the sides of the airshaft as he contin in total darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (using a radio now) Lower -- lower -- (to himself) Gee, this really is deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, his feet kick thin air as he gets to the bottom and swings free in some kind of tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Hold it!  Steady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a powerful flashlight from his utility belt and the tunnel below.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: He is suspended near the top of a beautifully preserved c rounded, polished tile walls ardorned with intricate, col Art Nouveau mosaics.  A finely inlaid sign identifies it STATION.

dialogues.speaker: STANTZ
dialogues.text: He pans the walls with his flashlight, admiring the excel and speaks quietly to Venkman and Spengler over his walki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reverently) This is it, boys, the end of the line.  Van Horne Station.  The old New York Pneumatic. It's still here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman has no idea what he's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining) The New York Pneumatic Railway.  It was an experimental subway system.  Fan-forced air-trains, built around 1870.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the walkie-talkie) This is about as deep as you can go under Manhattan without digging your own hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stantz) What's the reading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz shines his flashlight on the meter and whistles at high reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the radio) Off the top of the scale.  This place is really hot.  Lower me to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Venkman and Spengler feed him some more cable, he pans down the wall of the station, then onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Hold it!!  Stop!!  Whoa!!

dialogues.speaker: FLOOR
dialogues.text: Below him is a river of bubbling seething, glowing slime, torrent of disgusting ooze. As he stares into the foul effluent, we become aware of t amplified and magnified sounds of great ENGINES THROBBING the bowels of the city, of WATER RUSHING through pipes, S through ducts, the muffled RUMBLE of the SUBWAY and the R and mixed with it all, the unmistakable sounds of human c -- VOICES SHOUTING in anger, SCREAMING in fear, GROANING and eerie symphony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ranting on the radio) Oh, my God!  It's a seething, bubbling, psychic cess!  Interlocked tubes of plasm, crackling with negative GEVs!  It's glowing and moving!  It's -- it's a river of slime!!

dialogues.speaker: STANTZ
dialogues.text: He dangles from the end of the cable, holding his feet up can.  He unhooks a device from his utility belt and pulls it, shooting out a long telescoping fishing-pole with a s Reaching down, he scoops up a sample of the slime and sta the pole.

dialogues.speaker: SLIME
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a grotesque arm with a long skeletal fingers re the slime and snatches at Stantz's dangling feet.  He jer as several more arms poke up out of the slime and reach f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the radio) Haul me up, Venkman!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman and Spengler start hauling in the cable as a Con car drives up, and behind it, the same police car they sa burly SUPERVISOR gets out and crosses toward them, follow cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no nonsense) Okay, what's the story here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman and Spengler stop pulling up the cable and Venkma belligerent worker ploy again, only this time he's wearin hardhat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, I got time for this?  We got three thousand phones out in the Village and about eight million miles of cable to check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not buying it) The phone lines are over there. (points to the curb)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman pops Spengler on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz can be heard ranting over Venkman's walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Help!  Help!  Pull me up!  It's alive!  It's eating my boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman switches off the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't with Con Ed or the phone company. We checked.  Tell me another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman stares at the Cop for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas leak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz is hanging there, looking down into the shaft at t is now bubbling up the shaft after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Get me out of here!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desperate now, he kicks wildly and knocks loose a section rusting conduit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conduit falls on a heavy electrical transmission line through the cable with a SHOWER OF SPARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman, Spengler, the cops and the supervisor all react FLASH deep down in the hole and a SHOUT from Stantz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one, all the streetlights go out; then the lights buildings along East 77th street; then the whole neighbor out, and finally the entire city is plunged into darkness

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks around in the dark lighting candles and placing the living room.  Then she finds a transistor radio and t information about the blackout.  She listens to a special for a moment, then has a compelling impulse to go check o She crosses to the nursery carrying a candle and quietly and looks in.  Suddenly the DOORBELL RINGS, scaring her h Leaving the chain on the door, she opens it a crack and s standing in the hall, eerily lit by a red emergency spot the hallway.  He looks slightly dazed and even creepier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Janosz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Dana.  I happened to be in the neighborhood and I thought I'd stop by to see if everything's all right with you -- you know, with the blackout and everything? Are you okay?  Is the baby all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His affected concern is chilling.  She is frightened but from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mechanically and cautiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine, Janosz. He tires to look around her into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need anything?  You want me to come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, everything's fine.  Honestly.  Thanks anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, just thought I'd check.  Good night, Dana.  Sleep well.  Don't let the bedbugs bite you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Janosz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door behind him and double locks it, then staring into the candlelight, alone and afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janosz stands there in semi-darkness, then his eyes light headlights and he walks off down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JUDGE, a rather sour-looking jurist of the old school court to order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to make one thing very clear before we go any further.  The law does not recognize the existence of ghosts, and I don't believe in them either, so I don't want to hear a lot of malarkey about goblins and spooks and demons.  We're going to stick to the facts in this case and save the ghost stories for the kiddies.  Understood?

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE TABLE
dialogues.text: Stantz leans over and whispers to Spengler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like a pretty open-minded guy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His nickname is "The Hammer."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz and Spengler are seated with their attorney LOUIS CPA and former demonic possession victim.  Louis is despe through a mountain of legal textbooks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) I think you're making a big mistake here, fellas.  I do mostly tax law and some probate stuff occasionally.  I got my law degree at night school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right.  We got arrested at night.

dialogues.speaker: SPECTATORS' GALLERY
dialogues.text: Venkman is talking to Dana at the wooden rail in front of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could stay.  I feel personally responsible for you being here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are personally responsible.  If I can get conjugal rights, will you visit me at Sing Sing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't say that.  You won't go to prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me.  I'm like a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you cough up hairballs all over the rug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm El Gato.  I always land on my feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincerely) Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a quick, unexpected kiss and exits.  Venkma a moment then goes back to the defense table.

dialogues.speaker: PROSECUTION TABLE
dialogues.text: Jack Hardemeyer, the mayor's principal aide, is goading t a very sober, humorless woman in her late thirties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you doing, hon?  Just put these guys away fast and make sure they go away for a long, long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shouldn't be hard with this list of charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Very good.  The mayor and future governor won't forget this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles conspiratorially and makes a point of passing t on his way out of the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE TABLE
dialogues.text: The Ghostbusters look up as Hardemeyer approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gloating) Nice going, Venkman.  Violating a judicial restraining order, willful destruction of public property, fraud, malicious mischief -- smooth move.  See you in a couple years -- at your first parole hearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herdemeyer exits.  Louis looks devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, the whole city's against us.  I think I'm going to be sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spengler hands him a waste basket as the Prosecutor calls witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Con Ed Supervisor is testifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fianella, please look at Exhibits A through F on the table over there.  Do you recognize that equipment?

dialogues.speaker: EXHIBIT TABLE
dialogues.text: Lying on the table are the basic tools of the Ghostbustin proton packs and particle throwers, a couple of ghost tra meters and detection devices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.c.) That's the stuff the cops found in their truck.

dialogues.speaker: WITNESS STAND
dialogues.text: She continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what this equipment is used for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I don't know.  Catching ghosts, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Judge) May I remind the court that the defendants are under a judicial restraining order that specifically forbids them from performing services as paranormal investigators and eliminators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So noted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Mr. Fianella, can you identify the substance in the jar on the table marked Exhibit F?

dialogues.speaker: PROSECUTOR
dialogues.text: She goes to the exhibit table and picks up a specimen jar slime sample Stantz removed from the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been working underground for Con Ed for 27 years and I never saw anything like that in my life.  We checked out that tunnel the next day and we didn't find nothing.  If it was down there, they must have put it there.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSE TABLE
dialogues.text: Venkman and Spengler look at Stantz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) Hey, I didn't imagine it.  There must have been ten thousand gallons of it down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may be ebbing and flowing from some tidal source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) Should I say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt that they'd believe us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis moans and goes back to his notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman himself is on the stand and Louis is questioning

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So like you were just trying to help out your old friend because she was scared and you didn't really mean to do anything bad and you really love the city and won't ever do anything like this again, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection, your Honor.  He's leading the witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witness is leading him.  Sustained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let me rephrase that question. (to venkman) Didn't you once coach a basketball team for underprivileged children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I did.  We were city champs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection.  Irrelevant and immaterial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained.  Mr. Tully, do you have anything to ask this witness that may have some bearing on this case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Venkman) Do I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think you've helped them enough already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Judge) No, I guess not. (to the Prosecutor) Your witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prosecutor rises and approaches the witness stand wit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Dr. Venkman, please explain to the court why it is you and your co-defendants took it upon yourselves to dig a big hole in the middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy-seventh and First Avenue has so many holes already we didn't think anyone would notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gallery laughs and the Judge gavels for order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep that up, mister, and I'll find you in contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, your Honor, but when somebody sets me up like that I can't resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was unquestionably the worst presentation of a case I've ever heard in a court of law!  I ought to cite you for contempt and have you disbarred.  As for your clients, Peter Venkman, Raymond Stantz and Egon Spengler, on the charges of conspiracy, fraud and the willful destruction of public property, I find you guilty on all counts.  I order you to pay fines in the amount of $25,000 each and I sentence you to eighteen months in the city correctional facility at Ryker's Island.

You're beneath the contempt of this court.  And believe me, if my hands were not tied by the unalterable fetters of the law, a law which has become in my view far too permissive and inadequate in it's standards of punishment, I would invoke the tradition of our illustrious forebearers, reach back to a sterner, purer justice and have you burned at the stake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive) He was a very powerful magician.  A genius in many ways and quite a skilled painter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was also a lunatic and a genocidal madman. I hate this painting.  I've felt very uncomfortable since they brought it up from storage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's not the kind of thing you'd want to hang in the rec room.  You know what it needs? (picking up a brush) A fluffy little white kitten in the corner.

dialogues.text: My pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Mood slime.'  We ought to bottle this stuff and sell it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little embarrassed) Well, we sing to it, we talk to it, we say supportive, nurturing things --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: It shakes, spins and actually starts moving in time with

dialogues.speaker: VENKMAN
dialogues.text: He stares in disbelief at the dancing toaster as it shoot toast into the air and catches them without missing a bea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what you say.  This could be a major Christmas gift item.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, and the first time someone gets mad, their toaster will eat their hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we'll put a warning on the label.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz turns OFF the MUSIC and the toaster stops moving. at the toaster and sticks his fingers in the slot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the toaster) Go ahead.  I dare you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, he yelps as if the toaster has actually bitten and won't let go.  The others jump in to help him, but Ve easily withdraws his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana brings Oscar into the bathroom and lays him on the b wearing a robe over her nightgown, preparing to bathe the turns the taps on the old claw-footed bathtub, checks the temperature, then turns away and starts to undress the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking sweetly to the baby) Look at you.  I think we got more food on your shirt than we got in your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BATHTUB
dialogues.text: The water pouring from the faucet changes to slime and se bottom of the tub.  Dana reaches over and turns off the w looking into the tub.  When she turns away, both taps sta themselves and the tub flexes and bulges.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: Still unaware, she routinely reaches over and squirts som into the tub.

dialogues.speaker: BATHTUB
dialogues.text: The rim of the tub puckers up and the sides convulse as i bubble bath.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: She picks the baby up off the bassinet and turns to place She is just about to lower him into the water when the tu close up around the baby like a hugh mouth.  Dana screams baby away and runs from the room clutching Oscar to her b bathtub convulses and vomits up buckets of slime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big open loft space is a chaotic clutter of mismatche magazines, books, tapes, and sports equipment.  Venkman i floor, still wearing his coat, scarf, hat and gloves, hav just short of the bedroom.  The DOORBELL RINGS, he wakes his feet and answers it.  He opens the door and sees Dana She is wearing only a nightgown under her coat and Oscar wrapped in a baby blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (somewhat embarrassed to be there) I'm sorry.  Were you on your way out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised to see her) No, I just got in -- a couple hours ago. Come on in. (noting her apparel) Are we having a pajama party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset) Peter, the bathtub tried to eat Oscar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman looks at her for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if anyone else told me that, I'd have serious doubts.  But coming from you, I can't honestly say I'm surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must be losing my mind.  At the museum today I could have sworn that terrible painting of Vigo looked right at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who could blame him?  Were you wearing this nightgown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distraught) I don't know what to do anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get Ray and Egon to check out the bathtub.  You better stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits to the bathroom.  She looks around the loft, ama disorder.  Venkman comes back immediately with an old swe takes Oscar from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this kid has a serious nudity problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spreads the sweatshirt out on the sofa, lays the baby tying it around him like a diaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the baby) This is Joe Namath's old number, you know. You could get a lot of chicks with this. Just don't pee in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, what about the bathtub?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs the phone and dials) We'll take care of that. (on the phone) Ray, Pete.  Listen, get over to Dana's right away ... Her bathtub pulled a fast one -- tried to eat the kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was full of this awful pink ooze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ray) Sounds like another slime job ... No, they're all right.  They're here now ... Right ... Let me know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going over there right now.  You might as well make yourself at home.  Let me show you around. (he crosses to the kitchen area) This is the cuisine de maison --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an incredible mess. The sink is piled high with dirt counters are littered with all sorts of food trash.  He g Hefty bag on the floor and starts throwing garbage into i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the sink) We may have to wash some of these if you get hungry -- (he looks in the fridge) -- but there's no food anyway so forget about it.  I have all kinds of carry-out menus if you feel like ordering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens a drawer full of pizza, barbecue and Chinese foo crosses to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathroom's right here -- let me just tidy up a few things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, this is very nice, but you don't have to do any of this, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into the bathroom and we hear WATER RUNNING, the and more items going into the Hefty bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shower works but it's a little tricky. They're both marked "Hot."  It takes a little practice, but at least this one won't try and eat you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes out of the bathroom with the now-loaded Hefty ba shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful on that sofa -- it's a butt-biter. But the bed's good and I just changed the sheets so if you get tired, feel free.  In fact, I think you should definitely plan on spending the night here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  And how would we handle the sleeping arrangements?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me it's best if I sleep on my side and you spoon up right behind me with your arms around me.  If we go the other way I'm afraid your hair will be getting in my face all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you on the sofa and me in bed with the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or we could do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (she picks up Oscar) Poor baby.  I think I should put him down now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll put him down for you. (taking the baby) You are way too short!  And your belly-button sticks out!  You're nothing but a burden to your poor mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman carries the baby into the bedroom leaving Dana in room, feeling more relaxed and a lot safer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman is waiting in front of the building as ECTO-2 pul Stantz, Spengler and Winston get out and report on Dana's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find anything at Dana's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Just some mood-slime residue in and around the bathtub.  But we did turn up some interesting stuff on this Vigo character you mentioned.  I found the name Vigo the Carpathian in Leon Zundinger's Magicians, Martyrs and Madmen.  Listen to this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads from xerox of entry) "Vigo the Carpathian, born 1505, died 1610 --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred and five years?  He really hung on, didn't he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he didn't die of old age either.  He was poisoned, stabbed, shot, hung, stretched, disemboweled, drawn and quartered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess he wasn't too popular at the end there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not exactly a man of the people. (reads) "Also known as Vigo the Cruel, Vigo the Torturer, Vigo the Despised, and Vigo the Unholy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy was a bad monkey.  He dabbled in all the Black Arts, and listen to this prophecy.  Just before his head died, his last words were, "Death is but a door, time is but a window.  I'll be back."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?  "I'll be back?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rough translation from the Moldavian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the museum carrying their monitoring equipment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy the guard looks up in surprise as the Ghostbusters e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dr. Venkman.  What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just going up to Restorations for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I can't let you do that.  Mr. Poha told me not to let you up there anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with mock seriousness) Okay, we were trying to keep this quiet but I think you can be trusted.  Tell him, Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very official) Mister, you have an Ecto-paritic, subfusionary flux in this building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a flux?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a flux and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if you don't want to be the -- (he counts) -- fifth person ever to die in meta-shock from a planar rift, I suggest you get down behind that desk and don't move until we give you the signal "Stabilize -- All Clear."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy gulps and starts to hunker down behind the desk as t head upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janosz is working on the Vigo painting when the Ghostbust rushes over and stops them at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Venkman?  Dana is not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why have you come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a major creep alert and we're just going down the list.  Your name was first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spengler and Winston) Let's sweep it, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They deploy and start scanning the studio with their moni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Janosz) You know, I never got to ask you.  Where you from, Johnny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) The Upper West Side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (consulting his PKE meter) This entire room is extremely hot, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly are you looking for, Dr. Venkman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll know when we find it.  You just sit tight.  This won't take long.

dialogues.speaker: STANTZ
dialogues.text: Using the Giga-meter, he traces a strong psychomagnetheri the painting of Vigo in the alcove at the end of the stud comes up behind him with Janosz right on his heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the one that looked at Dana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be the chemical fumes in the studio. People start imagining things --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) I'm going to rule out the glue-sniffing theory.  If she says it looked at her, it looked at her. (to Vigo) Hey, you!  Vigie!  Look at me.  I'm talking to you.  Hey!  Look at me when I'm talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch the painting for any sign of movement.

dialogues.speaker: VIGO
dialogues.text: His eyes stare lifelessly into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: STANTZ AND VENKMAN
dialogues.text: Venkman starts shooting Polaroids of Vigo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vigo) Beautiful, beautiful.  Work with me, baby. Just have fun with it. (to Stantz) Okay, he's playing it cool.  Let's finish up and get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get one more reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman walks off leaving Stantz alone with the painting. the painting with the Giga-meter until his eyes meet Vigo

dialogues.speaker: VIGO
dialogues.text: His eyes seems to burn right through to the depths of Sta

dialogues.speaker: STANTZ
dialogues.text: He stands there transfixed, unable to look away, as a str transformation occurs within him.  Winston comes up behin the spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the painting) Now that's one ugly dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming back to his senses) Huh?  What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You finished here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted) What?  Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?  You coming down with something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm fine.  I just got light-headed for a second there.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: JANOSZ
dialogues.text: He escorts the Ghostbusters to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you see, everything is in order, is it not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not.  Don't leave town and report any change in your address to the proper authorities. We'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghostbusters cross to ECTO-2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's definitely something going on in that studio.  The PKE levels were max-plus and the Giga-meter was showing all red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd put my money on that Vigo character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's a safe bet. (to Stantz) You and Spengman see what else you can dig up on Vigo and this little weasel Poha. Those two were made for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghostbusters are driving back to the firehouse.  Stan wheel.  His eyes are vacant, he seems distracted and very swerves suddenly and HONKS the horn angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to another driver) Idiot! (honking) Move it, you jerk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman and Winston exchange surprised looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz drives extremely fast, HONKING vindictively, weavi through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston looks at Ray, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going a little fast, aren't we, Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz turns on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (viciously) Are you telling me how to drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just thought --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't think!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HONKS again and tromps hard on the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ecto-2 is now barreling down the avenue.  Pedestrians lea Stantz runs a red light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hang on to the safety straps as Stantz continues his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stantz, really worried now) Are you crazy, man?  You're going to kill somebody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz looks at him and smile demonically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm going to kill everybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swerves off the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car heads right for a big tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the last possible moment, Winston cold-cocks Stantz, g and steps across to stomp on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car skids into the tree and stops.  The Ghostbusters dazed and shaken, but unhurt.  Stantz rubs his eyes and l others, completely at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (himself again) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just picked up three penalty points on your driver's license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess so.  It was the strangest thing.  I knew what I was doing but I couldn't stop.  This really terrible feeling came over me and -- I don't know -- I just felt like driving into that tree and ending it all.  Whew!  Sorry, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They inspect the damage to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidentially, to Spengler) Watch him, Egon.  Don't even let him shave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a KNOCK at the front door, a key turns in the loc enters somewhat tentatively holding a bouquet of flowers suitcase of Dana's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out) I'm home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around the large open loft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) I knew it.  She cleaned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears the SHOWER RUNNING and crosses to the bathroom. half-open and he can see Dana in the shower (tastefully b the transparent vinyl curtain.  He closes the bathroom do the baby asleep on the bed, surrounded by pillows to prev off.  Then he turns and bumps into Dana who's just coming bathroom wrapped in a towel.  She jumps back into the bat She comes out again, this time wearing a robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all squeaky clean now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (humoring him) Yes, I'm very clean.  Did they find anything at my apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She squeezes past him into the bedroom and closes the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the door) Nothing.  They stayed there all night, went through your personal stuff, made a bunch of long-distance phone calls and cleaned out your refrigerator.  And didn't find anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana opens the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't find anything?  In the bathtub ... the pink ooze ... nothing?  So, what do I do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you get dressed and we go out.  I got a babysitter and everything.  Trust me, you need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not here to date.  I can't leave Oscar in a strange place with someone I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Janine Melnitz, from my staff.  She's one of my most valuable employees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she know anything about babies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine Melnitz, are you kidding? (handing her the flowers) Do I have a vase?  I brought some of your clothes.  Wear something intriguing.  I brought along some interesting possibilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but it's not a date.  It's a dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and closes the door again.  He opens the close looking for his good suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you happen to see some shirts on the floor in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put them in your hamper.  I thought they were dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I have a hamper?  Next time ask me first, okay.  I have more than two grades of laundry.  There're lots of subtle levels between clean and dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls some clothes out of the hamper and inspects them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These aren't so bad yet.  You just hang them up for a while and they're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine covers her computer terminal and starts turning ou Then she notices that the lights are still on upstairs. primping and freshening up her makeup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis is strapping on a proton pack, preparing to deal wi and for all.  He's wearing a bicyclist's rearview mirror

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Okay, Stinky, this is it.  Showdown time. You and me, pal.  You think you're smarter than I am?  We'll see about that. (loud) Oh, hello, Pizza Man!  Oh, two larges!  I only ordered one.  Oh, pepperoni and pineapple.  My absolute favorite.  I guess I'll have to eat these both by myself.

dialogues.speaker: THE CEILING
dialogues.text: Slimer pokes his head through the ceiling and scans the r upside down.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: He spots Slimer through the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Okay, let's boogie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whirls around and fires a proton stream at Slimer, sli gash across the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: Janine comes up and ducks as a bolt of energy streaks acr strikes the wall behind her.  Slimer disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed and apologetic) Oh migod!  I'm sorry.  I didn't mean to do that.  It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to get that smelly green thing. The guys asked me to help out.  I'm like the fifth Ghostbuster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you want to be a Ghostbuster if you're already an accountant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, it's just if one of the guys calls in sick or gets hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis quickly slips off the proton pack and sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you made any plans yet?  You know tomorrow is New Year's Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
