dialogues.text: No, I celebrate at the beginning of my corporate tax year which is March first. That way I beat the crowds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very practical.  I hate going out on New Year's Eve, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an awkward silence between them and Janine start

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good night, Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on an impulse) Janine, do you feel like maybe getting something to eat on the way home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to, but I told Dr. Venkman I'd babysit. (seductively) Do you want to babysit with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure, that sounds great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a KNOCK at the door and Venkman goes to answer i for the evening and looking very dapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman opens the door and finds Stantz, Spengler and Win there wearing over-the-hip rubberized waders, firemen's s miners' helmets, carrying tons of sensing devices, meters jars and photographic equipment.  They look like they're major spelunking expedition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ushering them in) Don't tell me, let me guess.  All-you-can-eat barbecue rib night at the Sizzler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going down into the sewer system to see if we can trace the source of the psycho-reactive slime flow.  We thought you might want to come along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darn it!  I wish I'd known you were going. I'm stuck with these damn dinner reservations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, animals and lower life forms often anticipate major disasters.  Given the new magnetheric readings we could see a tremendous breeding surge in the cockroach population.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roach breeding?  Sounds better and better. (calls out) Dana?  The boys are going down under the sewers tonight to look for slime.  Egon thinks there might even be some kind of big roach-breeding surge.  Should we forget about dinner and go with them instead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana steps into the living room looking very beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana looks curiously at their outfits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nod and wave back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ray and Egon) I think we're going to have to pass on the sewer trip, boys.  Let me know what you find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on his exit) Okay, but you're missing all the fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz, Spengler and Winston come down the stairs into th guided by a very old map of the underground city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.  Van Horne Station.  Right where the old transit map said it would be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cross to the edge of the platform and look into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get a sounding on the depth of that flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz has a long, coiled, graduated cord with a plumb bo it attached to his utility belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the cord in his hand, swings the plumb bob over casts it out into the middle of the flow.  The plumb bob Spengler reads the depth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six feet -- seven -- eight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  It's on the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine feet -- ten --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the line sinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the slime is rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz looks down and notices the slime rising over the e platform and around his boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Let's get out of here, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to pull out the plumb line but it seems to be s Spengler tries to help, but whatever is pulling on the co than all three of them.  As their unseen adversary pulls closer to the edge, Stantz works desperately to unhook th belt but finally just unhooks the whole belt.  Spengler l but Winston doesn't.  He is jerked off his feet and into Stantz and Spengler look at each other, summon their cour after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana and Venkman are sitting at a table in an elegant res caviar and toasting with very expensive champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very intimate) Here's to -- us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- are you making any New Year's resolutions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to stop getting involved with men who aren't good for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that start exactly at midnight tomorrow, or could you hold off for a few days maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For one night in your life, do you think it's possible for us to be completely real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, you want to be real?  So tell me why did you dump me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Peter, I didn't dump you.  I just had to protect myself.  You really weren't very good for me, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even good for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say things like that?  You're so much better than you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  If I had that kind of support on a daily basis, I could definitely shape up by the turn of the century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (already feeling the effects of the champagne) So why don't you give me a jingle in the year 2000?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me jingle you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans over to kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should call Janine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  Janine has a very special way with children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine is on the sofa doing her nails while Louis paces w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) I can't believe a person could actually live like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the baby) So these dwarfs had a limited partnership in a small mining operation and then one day a beautiful princess came to live with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really not a bad place.  It just needs a woman's touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So they bartered room and board in exchange for housekeeping services, which was a good deal for all of them because then they didn't have to withhold tax and social security, which I'm not saying is right but it's just a story, so I guess it's all right.  I can finish this later if you're tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis goes into the bedroom and puts the baby down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really good with children, Louis.  I can tell. (as he returns) Why don't you come here and sit with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits stiffly beside her on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting close) Motherhood is a very natural instinct for me.  I'd like to have a baby myself. Wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gulps) Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A manhole cover is dislodged and pushed up from below.  I and Winston crawls out of the manhole followed by Stantz They are exhausted and covered with slime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncharacteristically angry) Nice going, Ray!  What were you trying to do -- drown me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unusually mean) Look, Zeddemore, it wasn't my fault you were too stupid to drop that line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shoves him) You better watch your mouth, man, or I'll punch your lights out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?  Anytime, anytime.  Just go ahead and try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spengler steps between them with unprecedented aggression

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you two are looking for a fight, you got one. (putting up his fists) Who wants it first?  Come on, Ray.  Try me, sucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squaring off) Butt out, you pencil-necked geek.  I've had it with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They grab each other and start to tussle.  Suddenly Speng senses and pulls them apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcefully) Strip!  Right now!  Get out of those clothes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts yanking off his slicker and waders.  Bewildered Winston start doing the same.  Spengler helps pull off th throws them into the open manhole.  Now wearing only long seem to return to normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing?  Ray, I was ready to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see?  It's the slime.  That stuff is like pure, concentrated evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz looks around and sees that they are standing right museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's all flowing right to this spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAITRE D' looks up in surprise as Stantz, Spengler an the restaurant wearing only long underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intercepting them) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz looks around and spots Venkman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right, I see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They blow right by the Maitre d' who jumps back in horror

dialogues.speaker: VENKMAN
dialogues.text: He's just about to pour more champagne when he sees Ray, coming toward him through the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very excited) You should've been there, Venkman. Absolutely incredible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry I missed it. (noting their attire) I guess you guys didn't know about the dress code here.  It's really kind of a coat and tie place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all over the city, Pete -- well, under it actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rivers of the stuff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's all flowing toward the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures excitedly and a big gob of slime flies across lands on a well-dressed diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out) Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should discuss this somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman notes the look of alarm on Dana's face and pulls aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidentially) Boys, listen.  You're scaring the straights. Let's save this until tomorrow, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Venkman) This won't wait until tomorrow, Venkman. It's hot and it's ready to pop.

dialogues.speaker: MAITRE D'
dialogues.text: He hurries through the restaurant with two city COPS righ makes straight for Venkman's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrest these men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recognizing them) Hey!  It's the Ghostbusters.  You're out of uniform, gentlemen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz suddenly realizes how ridiculous they look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (self-conscious) Uh -- well -- we had a little accident, but forget that.  We have to see the mayor as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Doc, why don't you just go home. You'll get a good night's sleep and then you can give the mayor a call in the morning. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes Stantz by the arm but Stantz resists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going anywhere with you.  I told you we have to see the mayor now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Stantz) I'm warning you.  You can come along peaceably or --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs the Cop) Hey, don't be an idiot.  This is serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Look, pal, keep this up and you're going with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (has had enough) Yeah, let's go.  You're all under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cop catches Venkman in an armlock and starts walking restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dana) Finish your dessert -- it's already paid for.  I'll call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all exit, causing a major commotion among the other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car is parked right behind Ecto-2.  Spengler s police car and confronts the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we're not drunk and we're not crazy. This is a matter of vital importance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman steps in and looks at the policemen's nametags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to get your names right for when the mayor asks us why we didn't let him know about this sooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops look at each other, uncertain about what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relenting) Okay, Doc.  You want to see the mayor, you got it.  Follow us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head for their respective vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis and Janine are on the sofa making out when Dana ent up and start smoothing their clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Oh, hello, Dana.  we were just -- we were --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you were doing, Louis.  It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical.  Peter was arrested.  Has he called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nobody called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything all right with Oscar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's fine.  He's such a good baby.  He was a little fussy at first, but we gave him a Freach bread pizza and he went right to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Oh, good.  I'll just check on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana looks at Oscar sleeping peacefully on the bed.  She clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis and Janine aren't sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we should leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  We should stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Janine and they start making out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janosz stands before the painting of Vigo.  Vigo comes to repeats the litany of his power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, Vigo, the scourge of Carpathia --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heard all this before) Yes, the scourge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the sorrow of Moldavia --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the sorrow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I command you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking his watch) I await the word of Vigo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The season of evil begins with the birth of the new year.  Bring me the child that I might live again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abjectly humble) Lord Vigo, the mother, Dana, is fine and strong.  I was wondering -- well, would it be possible -- if I bring the baby, could I have the woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So be it.  On this the day of darkness, she will be ours, wife to you and mother to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Preceded by a police car, Ecto-2 enters the small park on at 88th Street and disappears into an underground entranc PANS UP to reveal Gracie Mansion, the residence of the Ma City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghostbusters, now wearing police raincoats over their ushered through the house by a butler to a set of double butler knocks lightly, then opens the door to reveal the front of the fireplace in his well-appointed private stud Jack Hardemeyer, both in tuxedoes.  The Ghostbusters ente

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor is impatient and a little angry at having been his formal reception.  He frowns at their bizarre attire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right -- the Ghostbusters.  I'll tell you right now; I've got two hundred of the heaviest campaign contributors in the city out there eating bad roast chicken waiting for me to give the speech of my life. You've got two minutes.  Make it good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get enough negative energy flowing in a dense environment like Manhattan, it starts to build up, and if we don't do something fast this whole place will blow like a frog on a hotplate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him about the toaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he's ready for the toaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Being miserable and treating other people like dirt is every New Yorker's God-given right.  What am I supposed to do -- go on television and tell eight million people they have to be nice to each other?  I'm sorry, none of this makes any sense to me, and if anything does happen we've got plenty of paid professionals to deal with it.  Your two minutes are up.  Good night, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mayor exits, leaving the Ghostbusters to Hardemeyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smirking) That's quite a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think the Times might be interested, don't you?  The Post might have a lot of fun with it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardemeyer's eyes go cold and calculating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you go running to the newspapers with this, would you consider telling this slime thing to some people downtown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An attendant opens a locked door with a wire mesh window Ghostbusters, in straitjackets, are led into the psych wa confers with the chief PSYCHIATRIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protesting) I'm telling you, we're not crazy.  He is!

dialogues.speaker: HARDEMEYER
dialogues.text: He laughs off the remark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Psychiatrist) The mayor wants them kept under strict observation for a few days.  We think they're seriously disturbed and potentially dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do whatever's necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardemeyer shakes his hand and exits as the door slams sh Ghostbusters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis and Janine are watching an old rerun on TV, eating Dana is stretched out on the other sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wishing they'd leave) You know you really don't have to stay. Peter should be back soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, we don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears a little CRY from the nursery and sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  I think Oscar is up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana enters and immediately notices that the crib is empt is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) Louis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frantic now, Dana rushes to the window and looks out, as come running in.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (ECLIPSE)
dialogues.text: The baby is standing out on the ledge at the corner of th fifty feet above the street, staring off into the distanc waiting for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana climbs out onto the ledge and starts inching slowly Then she stops as a miraculous apparition materializes.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS AND JANINE
dialogues.text: They lean out the window, gaping at the apparition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sweet, kindly-looking English nanny appears, pushing a on thin air parallel to the ledge high above the ground. remarkably like Janosz Poha's.  The nanny extends her han who GURGLES sweetly as he reaches out to take it.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: She watches in helpless horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) No!!

dialogues.speaker: GHOST NANNY
dialogues.text: She picks up the baby and lays it gently in the pram, the smiles at Dana.  The smile turns to a hideous grin, then shrieks at Dana and takes off like a shot with the baby.

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: She watches the creature fly off with Oscar, then climbs the window assisted by Louis and Janine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resolutely) Louis, you have to find Peter and tell him what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused and worried) Where're you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get my baby back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi pulls up, Dana jumps out and rushes into the museu the door closes behind her, there is a loud THUNDERCLAP, trembles and a massive amount of slime erupts from around the museum and starts covering the walls, sealing her ins building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman, Stantz, Spengler and Winston are in a padded cel handcuffed and the cuffs are chained to thick leather bel waists.  Venkman stands there banging his head into the p while the others try to explain the situation to a skepti Psychiatrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think the spirit of Vigo the Carpathian is alive in a painting at the Manhattan Museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. And are there any other paintings in the museum with bad spirits in them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient) You're wasting valuable time!  We have reason to believe that Vigo is drawing strength from a psychomagnetheric slime flow that's been collecting under the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, tell me about the slime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's potent stuff.  We made a toaster dance with it, then a bathtub tried to eat his friend's baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The psychiatrist looks at Venkman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me.  I think they're nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight streams through the skylight above, bathing the eerie white light.  Oscar is lying safely on a table in f painting of Vigo.  Dana enters cautiously and sees the ba one else about, she quickly sneaks down to the table and baby, hugging hin tight, greatly relieved to find him unh intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you would come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, Dana turns at the sound of his voice as Janosz behind the Vigo painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defiantly) What do you want with my baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No harm will come to the child.  You might even say it's a privilege.  He will be the vessel for the spirit of Vigo.  And you -- well, you will be the mother of the ruler of the world.  Doesn't that sound nice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is what the world will be like, I don't want to live in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidentially, indicating Vigo) I don't believe we have the luxury of choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody has a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in this case, my dear.  Take a look. That's not Gainsborough's Blue Boy up there. He's Vigo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care who he is.  He's not taking my baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana walks quickly to the door but suddenly Oscar flies o floats across the room and lands lightly back in the crad

dialogues.speaker: DANA
dialogues.text: She turns and looks at Vigo, for the first time feeling h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will see.  It's all for the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the last day of the year and the sun is shining brig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghostbusters are sitting in the dayroom, a dingy loun in the locked ward.  There is a television set, a Ping-Po few tables and chairs.  Stantz is looking at the sky thro wire mesh covering the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it. boys.  It's starting.  Shit-storm 2000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman is doing occupational therapy, weaving on a littl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It better not start yet.  I'm trying to finish my potholder before lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think all those predictions about the world coming to an end in the 1990s are true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PATIENT at the next table joins the discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with certainty) 1997.  My dog told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Labrador.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Habitual liars.  They can't help it.  It's in the breed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis is pleading with his cousin, SHERMAN TULLY, a docto at Parkview.  He looks and sounds just like Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Sherm.  You're my cousin.  Do this for me.  I'm begging you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it, Louis.  It isn't ethical.  I could lose my license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you just have them released? You're a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a dermatologist.  I can't write orders on the psych ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherman, I've done lots of favors for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you out of those bad tax shelters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the one who got me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fixed you up with Diane Troxler and she put out, didn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I had to give her free dermabrasion for a year.  Forget it, Louis.  I could get in a lot of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, we're all going to be in big trouble if we don't do something fast. That ghost guy came and took my friend's baby and we got to get it back.  It's just a scared little baby, Sherm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you should go to the police.  I don't believe in any of that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherman looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky begins to go dark as the sun is magically eclipse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room goes dark.  Louis switches on a lamp which casts on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spooky) Do you believe it now, Sherm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drainpipe starts dripping slime into the river near the docks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the Plaza Hotel in the background, the fountain star psycho-reactive slime.

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: A well-heeled MAN and WOMAN step out of a limousine and w toward the revolving door.  She looks up at the sky and f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrewish) I told you we should have stayed in Palm Beach.  The weather here gets stranger every year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't notice it, but a small amount of slime falls her luxurious, full-length, white mink coat.  The doorman courteously and extends a hand to help her up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: She yelps in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the doorman) Something just bit me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorman looks curiously at her, then recoils in shock comes alive.  MINK HEADS pop out of the thick fur, SNARLI YAPPING, their sharp, little teeth biting the air.  React doorman yanks the coat off the woman's back, throws it to starts stomping on it as the Woman and her husband look o The coat scuttles down the steps and runs off down the st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad room is busy as DETECTIVES try to answer the fl regarding the wave of supernatural events sweeping the ci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Look, lady, of course there are dead people there.  It's a cemetery ... (his face falls) They were asking you for directions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on another phone) Was this a big dinosaur or a little dinosaur? ... Oh, just the skeleton, huh?  Well, where is it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Wait a second -- the park bench was chasing you?  You mean, someone was chasing you in the park ... No, the bench itself was chasing you.  I see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weary SERGEANT answers a RINGING PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manhattan Central, Flaherty speaking ... Yeah ... yeah? ... What?  Who is this? ... Wait a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the caller on "Hold" and turns the LIEUTENANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, I think you better talk to this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on another call) What is it?  I'm talkin' here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's some dock supervisor down at Pier 34 on the Hudson.  The guy's going nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a deep breath) He says the Titanic just arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dock supervisor stands there with the phone in his ha beside him, both staring out the window at the ocean line pier.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (ECLIPSE)
dialogues.text: The name "R.M.S. Titanic" is clearly visible on the side ship.  The gangplank is down and dozens of drowned passen wet and festooned with seaweed, are disembarking while dr off-load their waterlogged baggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ecto-2 is parked outside as Louis and Sherman come out of with the Ghostbusters, now wearing their standard uniform

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work, Louis.  How did you get us out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I pulled a few strings.  I wouldn't want to say any more than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louis winks conspiratorially at Sherman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my cousin Sherman.  Sherm, say hello to the Ghostbusters. (sotto voce to Stantz) I promised him a ride in the car if he got you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Ghostbusters) Hi, it's really great to meet you guys.  I know this sounds weird but once I had a dream that my grandfather was standing at the foot of my bed, but I knew it was impossible because he died and he started to tell me that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While he's talking, the Ghostbusters jump in the Ectomobi off, leaving him and Louis standing at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Wait!  Okay, I'll meet you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were like the fifth Ghostbuster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I let them handle all the little stuff.  I just come in on the big ones.
(original version of the above scene - 11/27/88) (TRANSCRIBER'S NOTES: These two versions of this scene we copy of the script, so I have included both of them here)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, they still think you're crazy, but I convinced them you're not dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (determined) Yeah, well guess again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ecto-2 is parked outside and the Ghostbusters are hastily standard uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought everything you asked for and I gassed up the car with Super Unleaded.  It cost twenty cents more than Regular Unleaded but you get much better performance and in an old car like this that'll end up saving you money in the long run.  I put it on my credit card, so you can either reimburse me or I can take it out of petty cash --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While he's talking, the Ghostbusters jump in the Ecto-2 a off without him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Wait!  Okay, I'll meet you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ECTO-2 pulls to the curb across the street from the museu spectators are already there gawking at the building as t jump out and gape at the sight that greets them.

dialogues.speaker: BUILDING
dialogues.text: The building is now totally covered in a shell of psycho- CITY WORKMEN and FIREMEN are trying to cut their way in w jackhammers, power tools and the "jaws of life," but they a dent.

dialogues.speaker: GHOSTBUSTERS
dialogues.text: They size up the situation as they don their proton packs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a giant Jello mold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate Jello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stride manfully across the street and approach the m the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Fire Captain) Okay, give it a rest, Captain.  We'll take it from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical) Be my guest.  We been cutting here for three hours.  What the hell's going on?  You know the Titanic arrived this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, better late than never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The workmen and firemen put down their tools and fall bac Ghostbusters draw their particle throwers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (monitoring valences) Full neutronas, maser assist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They adjust their settings and prepare to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They trigger their throwers and spray the front doors of with bolts of proton energy, but it has no effect on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the firemen) Okay, who knows "Cumbaya?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of the firemen and workmen tentatively raise their grabs them and lines them up at the entrance of the museu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Nice and sweet -- (starts singing) Cumbaya, milord, cumbaya --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz, Spengler, Winston and the firemen sing along, rel hands and swaying to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Cumbaya, milord, cumbaya, Cumbaya, milord, cumbaya, Oh, Lord, cumbaya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz inspects the wall of slime with his infra-goggles they have only managed to open a hole the size of a dime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  The Vienna Boys Choir couldn't get through this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good effort.  Now what?  Should we say supportive, nurturing things to it, Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't work.  There's no way we could generate enough positive energy to crack that shell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe things have gotten so bad in this city that there's no way back. Sure, it's crowded, it's dirty, it's noisy. And there are too many people who'd just as soon step on your face as look at you.  But there've got to be a few sparks of sweet humanity left in this burned-out burg.  We just have to mobilize it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need something that everyone can get behind, a symbol --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes fall on ECTO-2's New York State license plate wh line drawing of the Statue of Liberty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he sees it, too) Something that appeals to the best in each and every one of us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something good --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And pure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And decent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a commotion among the crowd as the Mayor's limou with a police escort.  Jack Hardemeyer steps out followed himself and they cross to the museum entrance. Hardemeyer, his ASSISTANT and several police BODYGUARDS c Ghostbusters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I've had it with you.  Get your stuff together, get back in that clown car and get out of here.  This is a city matter and everything's under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you think so?  Well, I've got news for you.  You've got Dracula's brother-in-law in there and he's got my girlfriend and her kid.  Around about midnight tonight, when you're partying uptown, this guy's going to come to life and start doing amateur head transplants.  And that's just round one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling me there're people trapped in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his assistant) This is dynamite.  Call A.P., U.P.I., and C.N.N. and get them down here right away. When the police bring this kid out I want them to hand it right to the mayor and I want it all on camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mayor, if we don't do something by midnight, you're going to go down in history as the man who let New York get sucked down into the tenth level of hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor stops to consider the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Fire Captain) Can you get into that museum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had a nuclear warhead, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor turns to Venkman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why all these things are happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tried to tell you last night, but Mr. Hard-On over here packed us off to the loony bin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardemeyer flips out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is preposterous!  You can't seriously believe all this mumbo-jumbo!  It's the Twentieth Century, for crying out loud! (viciously, to Venkman) Look, mister, I don't know what this stuff is or how you got it all over the museum, but you better get it off and I mean right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pounds the wall of slime with his fist, and they all w amazement as his fist goes through the wall and he is suc through the slime curtain.  Only his shoes can be seen, e slime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Venkman) Okay, just tell me what you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the city skyline in the b.g., the Ghostbusters prepa equipment.  Each of them dons a makeshift backpack consis hoses, nozzles and an abundance of gauges, valves and reg Venkman looks up at the Statue of Liberty looming above t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of makes you wonder, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's naked under that toga.  She's French, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing under that toga but 300 tons of iron and steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz is looking worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope we have enough stuff to do the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one way to find out. (to Stantz) Ready, Teddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghostbusters are working from the iron staircase that straight up 100 feet inside the hollow super-structure of Spengler and Winston are busy assembling hundreds of wire various relays on the interior surface of the statue.  Ve are mounting large auditorium loudspeakers near the top o They finish the installation, then Stantz dons one of the and gives the order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, boys.  Let's frost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin hosing the inside of the statue with the psych slime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janine watches as Louis, wearing a Ghostbuster uniform, s proton pack onto his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure this is such a good idea?  Do they know you're doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, sure -- no.  But there's really not much to do here and they might need some back-up at the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very brave, Louis.  Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses Louis and he gets extremely self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh -- oh -- well, I better hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: EXT STREET OUTSIDE FIREHOUSE
dialogues.text: Louis stands on the street corner waiting for a bus.  Fin pulls up, Louis climbs aboard and finds Slimer behind the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman, Stantz, Spengler and Winston are standing in the windows in the crown of the statue.  It looks like they'r of an ocean liner, then the CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal t statue.

dialogues.speaker: STANTZ
dialogues.text: He plugs the main cable lead into a transformer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all yours, Pete. (checks his watch) There's not much time left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman plugs the speaker cable into a Walkman and gives

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving the downbeat) Okay, one, two, three, four --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits "Play" on the Walkman and "HIGHER AND HIGHER" BOO SPEAKERS, amplified by the statue's vast hollow interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The head of the statue lurches suddenly, but the Ghostbus the rail and manage to keep their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's moving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've lived in New York all my life and I never visited the Statue of Liberty.  Now I finally get here and we're taking her out for a walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the Giga-meter) We've got full power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz picks up a Nintendo control paddle from a home vid starts pushing the buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into a microphone) Okay, Libby.  Let's get it in gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They feel a strong vibration and the statue starts to mov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Years Eve celebrants line the riverfront, pointing an incredible sight.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (CONTINUOUS ACTION)
dialogues.text: The statue is moving up the river almost completely subme head from the nose up is visible above the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston looks out apprehensively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How deep does it get?  That water's cold and I can't swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  I have my Senior Lifesaving card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a water temperature of forty degrees we'd survive approximately fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz studies a maritime navigational chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep to the middle of the channel. We're okay to 59th Street, then we'll go ashore and take First Avenue to 79th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?  We'll hit all that bridge traffic at 59th.  I'm going to take 72nd straight up to Fifth.  Trust me, I used to drive a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spectators cheer wildly, inspired by the sight of the Sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janosz is sitting next to Dana, still wheedling her with self-serving logic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is running out, Dana.  Soon it will be midnight and the city will be mine -- and Vigo's.  Well, mainly Vigo's.  But we have a spectacular opportunity to make the best of our relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  Marry me, Dana, and together we will raise Vigo as our son.  There are many perks that come with being the mother of a living god.  I'm sure he will supply for us a magnificent apartment.  And perhaps a car and free parking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate and despise you and everything you stand for with all my heart and soul.  I could never forgive what you've done to me and my child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many marriages begin with a certain amount of distance, but after a while I believe we could learn to love each other.  Think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are jammed together shoulder to shoulder filling T watching the big Seiko clock count down the last ten minu Suddenly, they look down Broadway and see a magnificent s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Statue of Liberty is walking up Broadway approaching with "Higher and Higher" BOOMING from the SPEAKERS inside goes up, and the crowd goes wild with joy, dancing and si the MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spengler reads the Giga-meter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's working.  The positive GeV's are climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patting the Statue) They love you, Lib.  Keep it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The avenue has been closed to traffic and barricades plac the side streets.  A squadron of police motorcycles comes the corner at 72nd Street and proceeds up Fifth Avenue in of the museum.  Then MUSIC is heard BOOMING in the distan shakes and the Statue of Liberty comes walking around the Fifth Avenue followed by a wildly cheering throng.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghostbusters can see the museum ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) I'm worried.  The vibrations could shake her to pieces.  We should have padded her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think they make Nikes in her size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost there, Lib. (to Stantz) Step on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Statue's huge foot comes down and squashes a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghostbusters look down at the flattened car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts out the window) My Fault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) She's new in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janosz is painting the last of the mystical symbols on th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people still in the square start counting off the las midnight and the New Year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chanting) Ten .. nine ... eight ... seven ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strange light spreads over the painting.  As the light face, Vigo spreads his arms wide and his upper body start the canvas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon my life begins.  Then woe to the weak, all power to me, the world is mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby's body begins to glow as Vigo reaches out for it a dark shadow falls across the skylight.  Janosz looks up

dialogues.speaker: SKYLIGHT
dialogues.text: The Statue of Liberty is looming over the skylight lookin with an expression of righteous anger on it's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kneeling beside the museum, the statue draws back it's mi and smashes the skylight with its torch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janosz retreats from the shower of broken glass as the Gh sliding down ropes into the studio and confront Janosz wi weapons.  Quick as a flash, Dana seizes the moment, dashe studio and snatches the baby from Vigo's outstretched arm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Janosz) Happy New Year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigo bellows in rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janosz steps in front of the painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there.  Feel free to try something stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janosz sneers, trusting the invincibility of Vigo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pitiful, miserable creatures!  You dare to challenge the power of darkness?  Don't you realize what you are dealing with?  He's Vigo!  You are like the buzzing of flies to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Oh, Johnny.  Did you back the wrong horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, the Ghostbusters fire their slime-blowers and head to toe, blowing him into the corner.  Then they turn

dialogues.speaker: VIGO
dialogues.text: He is now almost completely out of the painting, but stil knees down.  He spits and rages at the Ghostbusters, tryi his magic powers.

dialogues.speaker: THE GHOSTBUSTERS
dialogues.text: They stand fast, secure in the knowledge that Vigo's powe neutralized by the good will of the people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigi, Vigi, Vigi -- you have been a bad little monkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole city's together on this one.  We took a vote.  Everybody's down on you, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arming his slime-blower) Say goodnight now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Vigo grabs Stantz by the neck and holds him up a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot!  You'll hit Ray!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strangling) Do it!  Just do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston fires and hoses both Vigo and Ray.

dialogues.speaker: VIGO
dialogues.text: He bellows and drops Ray, then falls back into the painti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paint turns liquid, melts off the canvas and runs ont revealing another painting underneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman, Spengler and Winston rush over to Ray and kneel is completely covered with slime and motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining him) He's breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston wipes the slime off Ray's face and Ray opens his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray -- Ray -- How do you feel, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles lovingly) Groovy.  I've never felt better in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.  We've got to live with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull him to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you guys.  You're the best friends I've ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs them each in turn, leaving them slimed as well. in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I just had this suit cleaned. (indicating Janosz) Take care of the wiggler, will you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman crosses to Dana who is snuggling the baby.  She h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this -- a love in? (notes the symbols painted on the baby's body) Hey, sailor.  I think the tattoos are a little much, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Venkman) I think he likes you.  I think I do too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally came to your senses, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: SPENGLER, WINSTON AND STANTZ
dialogues.text: They help Janosz to his feet.  He's dazed but unhurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (restored to normalcy) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Sir, you had a violent, prolonged, transformative psychic episode.  But it's over now.  Want a coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extremely nice) That's very kind of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stantz) He's fine, Ray.  Physically intact, psychomagnetherically neutral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's where you want to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they exit they stop to examine the painting that was c Vigo's self-portrait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late Renaissance, I think.  Caravaggio or Brunelleschi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at it) There's something very familiar about this painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful painting in the high-Renaissance style d archangels hovering protectively over a cherubic baby.  O one, an olive branch, the third, a book, and the last, a remarkably, their faces bear an uncanny resemblance to Ve Spengler and Winston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A city bus pulls up near the museum and Louis steps off. thanks to Slimer who is behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Slimer) Okay, so Monday night we'll get something to eat and maybe go bowling?  Can you bowl with those little arms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLIMER GRUNTS and SLOBBERS a reply, flexing his scrawny b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I have to go save Dana.  I'll see you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghostbusters are greeted by wild cheering and applaus out the main entrance with Dana and the baby.  Everybody "Auld Lang Syne."  Louis picks his way through the celebr finds the Ghostbusters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I too late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're right on time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stantz pops the cork on a bottle of champagne and hands i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardemeyer staggers out of the museum covered in slime. celebrating crowd and his eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weepy) Happy New Year, everybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He joins in on "Auld Lang Syne."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Statue of Liberty is sprawled inert on her back in th the museum, her toga up over her knees.  The Mayor looks The Ghostbusters stand beside him commiserating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's all right.  She's just sleeping it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stricken) We just had it restored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This probably isn't a good time to bring this up, but the last time we did a job for the city you stiffed us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing the Mayor an invoice) This is a bill for tonight's job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor looks at it and gasps at the amount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!  This is way too much. (hands the bill back to Venkman) We won't pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venkman looks at the Statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stantz) I think she looks pretty good here, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and a lot easier to get to than that island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realizing he has no alternative, the Mayor sighs and take

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right.  If you can wait until Monday I'll issue you a check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  No checks.  Company policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is shining brightly and Liberty is back on her pe belongs.  The Mayor and a host of officials are commemora The Ghostbusters, Dana, Janine and Louis are there as hon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up at the statue)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty impressive, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably the first thing my grandparents saw when they came to this country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From where -- Neptune?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They came from Ostrov in Eastern Poland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ostrov?  I've been there.  Good party town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a similarly reflective mood)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My great-grandparents were Swiss.  I still have the pictures they took of the statue from the boat when they arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right, you told me that.  They came to America seeking other kinds of cheese, as I recall.  How about you, Winston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My people weren't taking any pictures from those slave ships, man.  And there wasn't any Statue in Charleston Harbor to welcome them, either.  What are you, Dana?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Blue Blood?  Her family's been here since the year 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.  It was 1620.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your story, Pete?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  I'm a little of everything.  Some Irish, some German, some French, Dutch -- the women in my family slept around.  And that's what made this country great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a terrible thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?  It's a free country. (looking up at the Statue) Thanks, Lib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look up at the Statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slimer flies out one of the observation windows, THEME MU the CAMERA PULLS UP and AWAY FROM the island TO a HIGH SH Statue, lower Manhattan and the shining sea beyond.
